questionsData.title: pH scale measures the concentration of nitrogen ions.
questionsData.explain_answer:
pH scale measures the concentration of hydrogen ions.

The concentration of hydrogen ions (H+) is measured on the pH scale.
The pH scale indeed measures the concentration of hydrogen ions, not just "hydrogen" in general.  Hydrogen atoms can exist in different forms, but the pH scale specifically focuses on free-floating hydrogen ions (H+).

questionsData.title: The kinetic theory helps to understand the states of matter.
On rough surface the angle of incidence and reflection is the same.
questionsData.explain_answer:
On rough surface the angle of incidence and reflection is the different because the surface scatters the light ..

while On a smooth surface, the angle at which
light hits it is the same .

questionsData.title: The sound of people talking is measured in dB.
Typhoid, cholera and smallpox are diseases.
Rotate and spin are synonyms.
Frog and fish are covered in fur.
questionsData.explain_answer: False. Frogs and fish do not have fur. Frogs have smooth, wet skin, and fish have scales or slimy skin.

questionsData.title: Mule is crossbred between donkey and horse.
Curtains on windows allow people to look through.
Crash and accident are synonyms.
Spaceship is a kind of ship that comes from space.
Volcano happens when the plates move along the fault line.
Richter scale usually measures the number of deaths.
questionsData.explain_answer: The Richter scale is a scale used to measure  the strength of earthquakes .

questionsData.title: The adventurous person gets afraid to do anything.
questionsData.explain_answer: An adventurous person is not afraid to do anything.

questionsData.title: School teacher is someone who leaves school.
questionsData.explain_answer: School teacher is someone who works in a school .

questionsData.title: If you want to be a doctor, you must be confident.
"Dear Madam" is a polite way to greet a lady.
questionsData.explain_answer: • Formal without name: "Dear Sir or Madam" - This is still acceptable in some very formal situations, but it's generally better to try to find out the recipient's name.

questionsData.title: When you put water on fire, it boils.
Chilli, turmeric and ginger are kinds of food.
"Taken from" is the synonym of "sent to".
questionsData.explain_answer:
False – "Taken from" is not a synonym of "sent to."

  • "Taken from" means something has been removed or taken away from a source. For example: "The money was taken from the bank."

  • "Sent to" means something is being delivered or transferred to a destination. For example: "The package was sent to the customer."

These two phrases have opposite meanings. "Taken from" refers to removing from a location, while "sent to" refers to sending something to a location.

الترجمة والشرح بالعربية:

"Taken from" تعني أن شيئًا ما قد أُخذ أو تم سحبه من مصدر معين. على سبيل المثال: "تم أخذ المال من البنك."

"Sent to" تعني أن شيئًا ما يتم إرساله أو نقله إلى وجهة ما. على سبيل المثال: "تم إرسال الطرد إلى العميل."

الكلمتان تعنيان عكس بعضهما. "Taken from" تشير إلى الأخذ أو السحب من مكان معين، بينما "Sent to" تشير إلى الإرسال أو النقل إلى مكان معين.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about ……….
questionsData.article: Fruits and vegetables are full of important vitamins and minerals that our bodies need to be healthy. Scientific studies have shown that eating a lot of them can prevent some illnesses. Also fruits and vegetables don't contain much fat, and they don't have many calories, so they help us to keep thin. Doctors all agree that fruits and vegetables in general are good for you. People who eat a lot of fruits and vegetables (lose 2) weight more easily.  (They 3) help you to have good teeth, clear skin, nice hair, and strong bones. But what about the special powers of some fruits and vegetables like vitamin A in carrots which is necessary for the eyes. In fact, iron is also important for your blood, you can get iron in spinach, meat, eggs and beans. Also keep on eating oranges and other foods with vitamin C, such as lemons, kiwis and tomatoes. Finally, do apples really keep the doctors away? Apples do help to (prevent 1)cancer and heart disease. This is because apples have natural chemicals that protect the body. Therefore, people have to take a balanced diet which is full of fruits and vegetables to be healthy.

questionsData.title: He gave me …… piece of advice.
One of the following is NOT a compound word.
We feel well today. The word "well" is a /an ……….
The word…………. has a prefix.
A forest is . . . than a wood.
Jalal is not as . . . . as his friend.
Jackets are made ……… cloth.
Yemeni leaders ……. defend the country, are brave.
questionsData.explain_answer: The relative pronoun "who" is used to refer to people or human beings. Since the sentence is referring to Yemeni leaders, "who" is the appropriate choice.

questionsData.title: ……….his wife cooks well , he eats in a restaurant.

Bases that . . . . in water are called alkalis.
They are …… prepare the party food.
The boys ran in the streets, …… to catch the bus.
After he . . . . his lunch ,he went to do his homework

Khaled ….... books since 2020. He is professional.
.I watched the ants ….. the seeds from the store
questionsData.explain_answer:
The correct option would be "pulling."

The sentence indicates an action that is happening in the present, so the verb form should be in the present participle form (-ing) to match the tense.

In the given sentence, "I watched the ants," the verb "watched" is in the past tense, indicating that the action of watching the ants has already taken place. Following this, we need to describe what the ants were doing at that time.
